intro: Pojarkovia, commonly known as the Russian bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the temperate regions of Eurasia, particularly in the Russian Far East and parts of China. The plants typically feature showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a white or yellow throat. They are herbaceous perennials that thrive in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Pojarkovia species are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
